description.narrative: Advance decentralization & good governance at the local level through promoting nation-wide policy reform, empowering right holders to engage in political process. The project will operate in 3 regions (Kvemo Kartli, Mtskheta-Mtianeti and Imereti)

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
Output (RRF outcome) Indicators: 1.Number of subnational governments/administrations with transparent, accountable and effective planning, budgeting and monitoring systems (Target 2023: 20) 2. Level of public satisfaction with local governments (Target 2023: 85 % (general); 86% (women); 84% (youth 18-29); 85% (ethnic minorities)) 4. Level of citizen engagement in local decision making (Target 2023: 15% (general); 14% (women); 14% (youth 18-29); 15% (ethnic minorities))

comment.narrative:
Baseline Values 2018:
Output (RRF outcome) Indicator Baselines: 1. 0 subnational governments/administrations with transparent, accountable and effective planning, budgeting and monitoring systems 2. 17.6% local budgets within the consolidated budget 3. 68.5% level of public satisfaction with local governments (66.5% (women); 64.8% (youth 18-29); 70.3% (ethnic minorities)) 4. 6.5% of citizen engagement in local decision making (5.1% (women); 4.9% (youth 18-29); 6.9% (ethnic minorities))
Activity 1 (RRF Output 1): 1.1. 0 initiatives implemented from the Good Governance Strategy and action plan 1.2. 0 laws and policies adopted or initiated to fulfil GoG’s commitment with regard to decentralization 1.3. 24 municipalities with Gender Equality Councils and Gender Equality strategy/action plan in place 1.4. 1 municipality engaged in Open Government Partnership initiative
Activity 2 (RRF Output 2): 2.1. No national training system operational 2.2. 0 municipalities with effective human resources management systems 2.3. 0 municipalities with integrity strengthening systems established 2.4. 0 municipalities which apply and gender budgeting and strategic planning guidelines including localizing SDGs 2.5. 0 public officials qualified, including central and local government officials and municipal leadership desegregated by sex
Activity 3 (RRF Output 3): 3.1. 0 municipalities with performance management systems for selected services established through project support 3.2. 0 municipalities replicating performance management systems through the knowledge sharing platform 3.3. 47 municipalities with effective E-governance systems
Activity 4 (RRF Output 4): 4.1. 22.6% of public awareness about the LSG reform, participation tools and mechanisms (%). Sub-targets for women, youth and ethnic minorities (19.8% (women); 22.9% (youth 18-29); 17.2% (ethnic minorities)) 4.2. 0 Local Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) with strengthened capacities. 4.3. 0 citizen participation initiat

2020 Targets:
Output (RRF outcome): 1. Number of subnational governments/administrations with transparent, accountable and effective planning, budgeting and monitoring systems: 23 municipalities of 3 target regions (Kvemo Kartli, Imereti, Mtskheta-Mtianeti) 2. Local budgets within the consolidated budget: 18% 3. Level of public satisfaction with local governments: 70% 4. Level of citizen engagement in local decision making: 10%
Activity 1 (RRF Output 1): 1.1. 30% of initiatives implemented from the Good Governance Strategy and action plan 1.2. 50 laws and policies adopted or initiated to fulfil GoG’s commitment with regard to decentralization 1.3. 40 municipalities with Gender Equality Councils and Gender Equality strategy/action plan in place 1.4. 3 municipalities engaged in Open Government Partnership initiative
Activity 2 (RRF Output 2): 2.1. National training system operational: yes 2.2. 10 municipalities with effective human resources management systems 2.3. 10 municipalities with integrity strengthening systems established 2.4. 10 municipalities which apply and gender budgeting and strategic planning guidelines including localizing SDGs 2.5. 200 public officials qualified, including central and local government officials and municipal leadership (at least 30% female)
Activity 3 (RRF Output 3): 3.1. 4 municipalities with performance management systems for selected services established through project support 3.2. 5 municipalities replicating performance management systems through the knowledge sharing platform 3.3. 64 municipalities with effective E-governance systems
Activity 4 (RRF Output 4): 4.1. Level of public awareness about the LSG reform, participation tools and mechanisms: 30 % (general) - 28% (women); 30 % (youth 18-29); 25 % (ethnic minorities) 4.2. Number of local Civil Society Organization (CSO) with strengthened capacities: 15 (general) - 2 (women), 1 (youth), 1 (ethnic minorities) 4.3. Number of citizen participation initiative implemented by CSOs: 10 (general) - 2 (women), 1 (youth), 1(ethnic minorities) 4.4. 10 communities with mobilization schemes developed with active engagement of youth, women or ethnic minorities

2020 Results:
Output (RRF outcome): 1. Number of subnational governments/administrations with transparent, accountable and effective planning, budgeting and monitoring systems: 37 municipalities of 6 regions targeted by DGG and FRLD 2 with Municipal Development Documents (MDDs) integrating gender budgeting principles and linkages with SDG indicators. 2. Local budgets within the consolidated budget (%): 18.1% local budgets (including Tbilisi) within the consolidated budget. Source: MoF, 2019 budget execution reports 3. Level of public satisfaction with local governments: 67.3% nationwide (general), 67.3% - women, 58.3% - youth, 64.8% - ethnic minorities. Source: survey on citizens’ satisfaction with public services in Georgia administered by UNDP Georgia in 2019 4. Level of citizen engagement in local decision making: 9.5% nationwide (general), 8.9% - women, 8.1% - youth, 8.7% - ethnic minorities. Source: survey on citizens’ satisfaction with public services in Georgia administered by UNDP Georgia in 2019
Activity 1 (RRF Output 1): 1.1. % of initiatives implemented from the Decentralization Strategy and action plan: 58% of initiatives implemented (accomplished or nearly accomplished with UNDP Georgia support) from the Action Plan 1.2. Number of laws and policies adopted or initiated to fulfil GoG’s commitment with regard to decentralization: 180 adopted or initiated: 178 adopted, 2 initiated 1.3. Number of municipalities with Gender Equality Councils and Gender Equality strategy/action plan in place: 65 Gender Equality Action plans were elaborated in 65 municipalities of Georgia (in 60 municipalities with GiZ support, and in 5 municipalities with UNDP support). Currently the process of approving Gender Equality Action Plans is underway. As of January 2019, 48 municipalities had approved Action Plans. Source: Women’s Information Centre 1.4. Number of municipalities engaged in Open Government Partnership initiative: 6 municipalities engaged in OGP initiative: in addition to Tbilisi (baseline), five municipalities (Bolnisi, Dusheti, Tskaltubo, Rustavi, and Khoni) engaged in OGP initiative with the project support.
Activity 2 (RRF Output 2): 2.1. National training system operational: Yes - the rules and procedures for conducting professional development needs assessment and establishing professional developments standards for civil servants at central and local levels are in place and operational (adopted by the GoG on 22 May 2018, Decree #242). Quality assurance mechanisms for the basic training programs are operational. 2.2. Number of municipalities with effective human resources management systems: 23 municipalities with effective HR Management system: (a) Performance appraisal system established and operational in 12 target municipalities in partnership with CSB (2019 progress); (b) 23 municipalities (plus Tbilisi) covered through trainings (organized during 2019-2020) in HR Management, performance appraisal, administrative process management, effective management skills, psychology in HR 2.3. Number of municipalities with integrity strengthening systems established: 6 accomplished: 5 municipalities (Rustavi, Tskaltubo, Dusheti, Bolnisi, Khoni) and (Tbilisi) with elaborated local Anti-Corruption Strategies and Action Plans and Monitoring frameworks 2.4. Number of municipalities which apply gender budgeting and strategic planning guidelines including localizing SDGs: (i) 37 municipalities of 6 regions targeted by DGG and FRLD 2 with Municipal Development Documents (MDDs) upgraded In line with the newly developed methodology integrating gender budgeting principles and linkages with SDG indicators. (ii) One municipality - Tbilisi - with mainstreamed gender aspects in 2019 budget (2019 progress). Additional 5 municipalities (Gardabani, Rustavi, Samtredia, Terjola and Kazbegi) provided with training in Gender Responsive Budgeting and recommendations on integrating gender aspects in respective budgets. 2.5. Number of public officials qualified, including central and local government officials and municipal leadership (at least 30% female): 1,143 public officials trained (2018-2020); 686 (60%) female, 457 (40%) male; 853 local / 290 national officials
Activity 3 (RRF Output 3): 3.1. Number of municipalities with performance management systems for selected services established through project support: In progress for 8 municipalities targeted by DGG and FRLD 3.2. Number of municipalities replicating performance management systems through the knowledge sharing platform: In progress - replication and promotion of PMS to be accomplished in additional 15 municipalities targeted by DGG and FRLD 2 upon successful piloting in 8 municipalities 3.3. Number of municipalities with effective E-governance systems: In progress for 64 municipalities - the e-tool is being developed by the Municipal Service Development Agency (MSDA) for the management of municipal service delivery through the unified e-platform. The tool is currently being introduced in 21 municipalities.
Activity 4 (RRF Output 4): 4.1. Level of public awareness about the LSG reform, participation tools and mechanisms: 25.0% (general) - 24.9% (women), 21.4% (youth), 17.8% (ethnic minorities). Source: 2019 Survey on Citizens Satisfaction administered by UNDP Georgia (FRLD 2 project) 4.2. Number of local Civil Society Organization (CSO) with strengthened capacities: 17 local CSOs with strenghtened capacities through granting mechanism: 9 led by/working on empowering women, 5 led by/working on empowering youth 1 led by/working on empowering ethnic minorities. 4.3. Number of citizen participation initiative implemented by CSOs: 12 implemented or in progress: 1 initiative implemented in 2019 (by AGORA CE), 11 citizen participation and social accountability initiatives in progress - 5 targeted at/led by women, 5 targeted at/led by youth, 2 targeted at/led by ethnic minorities 4.4. Number of communities with mobilization schemes developed with active engagement of youth, women or ethnic minorities - 13 accomplished/in progress: (i) 2 accomplished in 2019: micro grants scheme launched in Chiatura and Tkibuli communities of Imereti region by local CSO Orbeliani to encourage citizen engagement and volunteer activities in the local communities. (ii) 11 in progress in 2020: 3 municipalities in Guria (Ozurgeti, Lanchkhuti, Chokhatauri), 4 municipalities in Kvemo Kartli (Dmanisi, Bolnisi, Gardabani, Marneuli), 4 communities in Ozurgeti Municipality.

2021 Targets:
Output (RRF outcome): 1. Number of subnational governments/administrations with transparent, accountable and effective planning, budgeting and monitoring systems: 20 municipalities 2. Local budgets within the consolidated budget: 18.5% 3. Level of public satisfaction with local governments: 72% 4. Level of citizen engagement in local decision making: 12%
Activity 1 (RRF Output 1): 1.1. 50% of initiatives implemented from the Good Governance Strategy and action plan 1.2. 100 laws and policies adopted or initiated to fulfil GoG’s commitment with regard to decentralization 1.3. 50 municipalities with Gender Equality Councils and Gender Equality strategy/action plan in place 1.4. 5 municipalities engaged in Open Government Partnership initiative
Activity 2 (RRF Output 2): 2.1. National training system operational: yes 2.2. 15 municipalities with effective human resources management systems 2.3. 10 municipalities with integrity strengthening systems established 2.4. 15 municipalities which apply and gender budgeting and strategic planning guidelines including localizing SDGs 2.5. 300 public officials qualified, including central and local government officials and municipal leadership (at least 30% female)
Activity 3 (RRF Output 3): 3.1. 6 municipalities with performance management systems for selected services established through project support 3.2. 8 municipalities replicating performance management systems through the knowledge sharing platform 3.3. 64 municipalities with effective E-governance systems
Activity 4 (RRF Output 4): 4.1. Level of public awareness about the LSG reform, participation tools and mechanisms: 33% (general/nationwide) 4.2. Number of local Civil Society Organization (CSO) with strengthened capacities: 15 (general) - 2 (women), 1 (youth), 1 (ethnic minorities) 4.3. Number of citizen participation initiative implemented by CSOs: 10 (general) - 2 (women), 1 (youth), 1(ethnic minorities) 4.4. 15 communities with mobilization schemes developed with active engagement of youth, women or ethnic minorities

2021 Results:
Output (RRF outcome): 1. Number of subnational governments/administrations with transparent, accountable and effective planning, budgeting and monitoring systems: 39 municipalities covered during 2019-2021: (i) 37 municipalities of 6 regions targeted by DGG and FRLD 2 with Municipal Development Documents (MDDs) integrating gender budgeting principles and linkages with SDG indicators (2020 achievement). (ii) 10 municipalities with improved quality of budgeting trough introducing gender budgeting principles and SDG linkages (2021 achievement) 2. Local budgets within the consolidated budget (%): 15.5% (including Tbilisi) within the consolidated budget. Source: MoF, 2020 budget execution reports 3. Level of public satisfaction with local governments: 60.6% nationwide (general), 61.5% - women, 61% - youth, 61.3% - ethnic minorities. Source: survey on citizens’ satisfaction with public services in Georgia administered by UNDP Georgia in 2021 4. Level of citizen engagement in local decision making: 6.9% nationwide (general), 6.8% - women, 3.9% - youth, 5.6% - ethnic minorities. Source: survey on citizens’ satisfaction with public services in Georgia administered by UNDP Georgia in 2021
Activity 1 (RRF Output 1): 1.1. % of initiatives implemented from the Decentralization Strategy and action plan: 80.8% (21/26) of activities of the DS Action Plan 2020-2021 are fully implemented and 19.2% (5/26) of activities are mostly completed. Precisely, 91.1% (41/46) of indicators are fully and 10.9% (5/46) mostly completed. Out of these 26 activities, 22 (84.6%) were implemented with UNDP support, which mostly encompassed the preparation and adoption of a series of laws, policies, and draft amendments. 1.2. Number of laws and policies adopted or initiated to fulfil GoG’s commitment with regard to decentralization: 180 laws/policies adopted or initiated as of December 2021 1.3. Number of municipalities with Gender Equality Councils and Gender Equality strategy/action plan in place: 64 municipalities: (i) As of December 2020, Gender Equality Councils and Action Plans were in place in 64 municipalities. (ii) Following the Local Elections in 2021, new Gender Equality Councils should be formed, reflecting the post-electoral changes in Local Councils and City Halls. The legal obligation to set up such mechanism remains in place for all 64 municipalities and the process is underway. Furthermore, previous Gender Equality Action Plans expired and currently municipalities are in the process of drafting the new ones. As such, currently 4 municipalities have newly approved Gender Equality Action Plans, 10 municipalities have draft Action Plans, 10 are in the process of drafting the plans, and 16 municipalities are at the preliminary stage. The remaining 24 municipalities will draft and approve their action plans in 2022. 1.4. Number of municipalities engaged in Open Government Partnership initiative: 6 municipalities engaged in OGP initiative: in addition to Tbilisi (baseline), five municipalities (Bolnisi, Dusheti, Tskaltubo, Rustavi, and Khoni) engaged in OGP initiative with the project support. In 2021, OGP process at the national level was hampered due to pandemic, therefore the new Action Plan for 2020-2021, which should have engage the new municipalities, was not elaborated. Despite this circumstance, Khoni Municipality engaged in OGP Local program independently in 2020 and is implementing its own Action Plan for 2021.
Activity 2 (RRF Output 2): 2.1. National training system operational: Yes. The rules and procedures for conducting professional development needs assessment and establishing professional developments standards for civil servants at central and local levels are in place and operational (adopted by the GoG on 22 May 2018, Decree #242). Quality assurance mechanisms for the basic training programs are operational. In 2021, a review of professional development system was conducted and and an action plan of CSB and MRDI is drafted to improve the training system operation at the local level. 2.2. Number of municipalities with effective human resources management systems: 24 municipalities with effective HR Management system: (a) Performance appraisal system established and operational in 24 municipalities (including Akhalgori Municipality Administration) of Imereti, Kvemo Kartli and Mtskheta-Mtianeti Regions in partnership with CSB (2019-2021); (b) 25 municipalities (including Tbilisi and Akhalgori Municipality Administration) covered through trainings (organized during 2019-2021) in HR Management, performance appraisal, administrative process management, effective management skills, psychology in HR, mentoring program 2.3. Number of municipalities with integrity strengthening systems established: 6 accomplished during 2019-2021: 5 municipalities (Rustavi, Tskaltubo, Dusheti, Bolnisi, Khoni) and (Tbilisi) with elaborated local Anti-Corruption Strategies and Action Plans and Monitoring frameworks as of December 2020. In 2021, implementation of this activity was linked with OGP process hampered by the pandemic. Furthermore, pandemic-related crisis and local elections 2021 made elaboration of the new policy document unfeasible. Therefore, the activity is intended to be resumed in 2022. 2.4. Number of municipalities which apply gender budgeting and strategic planning guidelines including localizing SDGs: 41 municipalities of 8 regions: In addition to 2019-2020 achievements, in 2021 (i) 10 municipalities (Dmanisi, Dusheti, Vani, Tetritskaro, Tianeti, Mtskheta, Baghdati, Kutaisi, Tsalka, Tskaltubo), including 3 populated with ethnic minorities, were provided with technical support - trainings, workshops and consultancies throughout the budgeting cycle - to improve the quality of their program budgeting through introducing Gender Budgeting principles; (ii) 5 municipalities (Batumi, Kutaisi, Zugdidi, Rustavi, Telavi) with increased capacity in implementing and monitoring SDGs at the local level according to the SDG Localization Action Plan. 2.5. Number of public officials qualified, including central and local government officials and municipal leadership (at least 30% female): 1,544 public officials trained (2018-2021); 922 (60%) female, 622 (40%) male; 1167 local / 377 national officials
Activity 3 (RRF Output 3): 3.1. Number of municipalities with performance management systems for selected services established through project support: In progress for 8 municipalities targeted by DGG and FRLD 2 projects 3.2. Number of municipalities replicating performance management systems through the knowledge sharing platform: In progress: replication and promotion of PMS to be accomplished in additional 15 municipalities targeted by DGG and FRLD 2 upon successful piloting in 8 municipalities 3.3. Number of municipalities with effective E-governance systems: Accomplished in 62 municipalities, in progress in 2 municipalities: the e-tool developed by the Municipal Service Development Agency (MSDA) for the management of municipal service delivery through the unified e-platform has been introduced in 62 municipalities. The tool is currently being introduced in 2 municipalities.
Activity 4 (RRF Output 4): 4.1. Level of public awareness about the LSG reform, participation tools and mechanisms: General/nationwide: 32.0%; Women: 31.4%, Youth: 33.5%; Ethnic minorities: 25.4%. Source: 2021 Survey on Citizens Satisfaction administered by UNDP Georgia (FRLD 2 project) 4.2. Number of local Civil Society Organization (CSO) with strengthened capacities: 62 local Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) with strengthened capacities: (i) 17 local CSOs with strengthened capacities through UNDP granting mechanism (9 led by/working on empowering women, 5 led by/working on empowering youth, 1 led by/working on empowering ethnic minorities); (ii) 29 local CSOs based and operational in Imereti region with strengthened capacities in citizen participation mechanisms through the grant with Local Democracy Agency Georgia (LDA); (iii) 16 local CSOs based and operational in Racha-Lechkhumi & Kvemo Svaneti and Kvemo Kartli regions with increased capacities in civic engagement through the mentorship program conducted by the grant recipient Association of Young Economists of Georgia (AYEG) 4.3. Number of citizen participation initiative implemented by CSOs: 12 implemented or in progress: (i) 1 initiative implemented in 2019 (by AGORA CE); 9 citizen participation and social accountability initiatives implemented by grant recipient CSOs in 2020-2021 (4 targeted at/led by women, 4 targeted at/led by youth, 2 targeted at/led by ethnic minorities); (ii) 2 citizen participation initiatives in progress (1 targeted at/led by women, 1 targeted at/led by youth) 4.4. Number of communities with mobilization schemes developed with active engagement of youth, women or ethnic minorities: 34 accomplished during 2019-2021: (i) 2 accomplished in 2019: micro grants scheme launched in Chiatura and Tkibuli communities of Imereti region by local CSO Orbeliani to encourage citizen engagement and volunteer activities in the local communities; (ii) 32 accomplished in 2021: 37 community-led initiatives implemented in 32 communities of 8 municipalities (Rustavi, Marneuli, Dmanisi, Bolnisi, Gardabani, Ozurgeti, Lanchkhuti, Chokhatauri) in Kvemo Kartli and Guria regions

Output (RRF outcome) Indicator Targets: 1. Number of subnational governments/administrations with transparent, accountable and effective planning, budgeting and monitoring systems: N/A for 2019 2. Local budgets within the consolidated budget (%): N/A for 2019 3. Level of public satisfaction with local governments: N/A for 2019 4. Level of citizen engagement in local decision making: N/A for 2019
Activity 1 (RRF Output 1) Indicator Targets: 1.1. 15% of initiatives implemented from the Good Governance Strategy and action plan 1.2. 0 laws and policies adopted or initiated to fulfil GoG’s commitment with regard to decentralization 1.3. 40 municipalities with Gender Equality Councils and Gender Equality strategy/action plan in place 1.4. 3 municipalities engaged in Open Government Partnership initiative
Activity 2 (RRF Output 2) Indicator Targets: 2.1. National training system operational: yes 2.2. 10 municipalities with effective human resources management systems 2.3. 3 municipalities with integrity strengthening systems established 2.4. 5 municipalities which apply and gender budgeting and strategic planning guidelines including localizing SDGs 2.5. 200 public officials qualified, including central and local government officials and municipal leadership
Activity 3 (RRF Output 3) Indicator Targets: 3.1. 4 municipalities with performance management systems for selected services established through project support 3.2. 0 municipalities replicating performance management systems through the knowledge sharing platform 3.3. 0 municipalities with effective E-governance systems
Activity 4 (RRF Output 4) Indicator Targets: 4.1. Level of public awareness about the LSG reform, participation tools and mechanisms: N/A for 2019 4.2. 1 local Civil Society Organization (CSO) with strengthened capacities. 4.3. 1 citizen participation initiative implemented by CSOs. 4.4. 2 communities with mobilization schemes developed with active engagement of youth, women or ethnic minorities

Output (RRF outcome) Indicator Results: 1. Number of subnational governments/administrations with transparent, accountable and effective planning, budgeting and monitoring systems: N/A – to be measured through evaluation 2. Local budgets within the consolidated budget (%): 16.9% - the status update is based on 2019 planned budget data. Final budget data will be available in March 2020, upon releasing the Budget Execution Report (Source: MoF) 3. Level of public satisfaction with local governments: N/A – being measured through the survey on citizens’ satisfaction with public services in Georgia (to be accomplished by March 2020) 4. Level of citizen engagement in local decision making: N/A – being measured through the survey on citizens’ satisfaction with public services in Georgia (to be accomplished by March 2020)
Activity 1 (RRF Output 1) Indicator Results: 1.1. % of initiatives implemented from the Good Governance Strategy and action plan: 69% of the activities of Decentralization Strategy Action Plan are in progress, 4% completed 1.2. 8 laws/policies adopted or drafted with the project support to fulfil GoG’s commitment with regard to decentralization: 3 adopted, 5 drafted and pending approval 1.3. 65 municipalities with Gender Equality Councils and Gender Equality strategy/action plan in place 1.4. 6 municipalities engaged in Open Government Partnership initiative: in addition to Tbilisi (baseline), five municipalities (Bolnisi, Dusheti, Tskaltubo, Rustavi, and Khoni) engaged in OGP initiative with the project support
Activity 2 (RRF Output 2) Indicator Targets: 2.1. National training system operational: Yes - the rules and procedures for conducting professional development needs assessment and establishing professional developments standards for civil servants at central and local levels are in place and operational (adopted by the GoG on 22 May 2018, Decree #242). Quality assurance mechanisms for the basic training programs are operational. 2.2. # of municipalities with effective human resources management systems: Accomplished in 23 municipalities: (i) Performance appraisal system established and operational in all 23 target municipalities; (ii) 81 local civil servants (55 women, 26 men) from 20 municipalities of 3 target regions with improved capacities in HR Management/performance appraisal/administrative process management/ effective management skills 2.3. # of municipalities with integrity strengthening systems established: In progress in 6 municipalities: 5 municipalities (Rustavi, Tskaltubo, Dusheti, Bolnisi, Khoni) with elaborated local Anti-Corruption Strategies, Action Plans and Monitoring frameworks (pending approval); 1 (Tbilisi) - in progress. 2.4. # of municipalities which apply and gender budgeting and strategic planning guidelines including localizing SDGs: Gender budgeting – accomplished in one municipality, in progress in 5 municipalities: Tbilisi municipality mainstreamed gender aspects in 2019 budget, while additional 5 municipalities (Gardabani, Rustavi, Samtredia, Terjola and Kazbegi) were provided with training in GRB and recommendations for integrating gender aspects in the upcoming years budgets. In addition, introduction of strategic planning is in progress in 39 municipalities: support provided to 39 municipalities (16 targeted by DGG, 23 targeted by FRLD 2) in upgrading the municipal development planning documents and their methodology to integrate strategic planning elements with a focus on LED and gender equality. 2.5. # of public officials qualified, including central and local government officials and municipal leadership: 974 public officials trained: 599 (61.5%) women, 375 (38.5%) men; 713 local and 261 central government officials
Activity 3 (RRF Output 3) Indicator Targets: 3.1. Number of municipalities with performance management systems for selected services established through project support: in progress for 8 municipalities - a consultancy company was contracted to develop and pilot performance management systems for two municipal services - cleaning of streets, parks, public gardens and other public areas in the territory of the municipality, and municipal waste management in eight municipalities 3.2. Number of municipalities replicating performance management systems through the knowledge sharing platform: In progress - replication and promotion of PMS to be accomplished in additional 15 municipalities targeted by DGG and FRLD 2 upon successful piloting in 8 municipalities 3.3. Number municipalities with effective E-governance systems: in progress for 64 municipalities - the e-tool is being developed by the Municipal Service Development Agency (MSDA) for the management of municipal service delivery through the unified e-platform
Activity 4 (RRF Output 4) Indicator Targets: 4.1. Level of public awareness about the LSG reform, participation tools and mechanisms: being measured through the survey on citizens’ satisfaction with public services in Georgia (to be accomplished by March 2020) 4.2. Number of local Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) with strengthened capacities: Low Value Grant Agreement was signed with one local (Rustavi-based) CSO Orbeliani to create opportunity for implementing community-driven initiatives 4.3. Number of citizen participation initiatives implemented by CSOs: 1 initiative implemented: the project envisaging youth participation implemented by AGORA CE, mobilizing up to 2,300 citizens in 5 municipalities to support 15 youth-led urban development ideas 4.4. Number of communities with mobilization schemes developed with active engagement of youth, women or ethnic minorities: 2 in progress - micro grants scheme launched in Chiatura and Tkibuli communities of Imereti region by local CSO Orbeliani to encourage citizen engagement and volunteer activities in the local communities
